column2: GEORGIA DMV TEST
column4: Georgia
column6: GA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: You must make a U-turn.
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

column2: 3. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 4. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 5. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No stopping

column2: 7. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.

column2: 8. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: a stop sign.
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 9. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column2: 10. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Yield.
column6: Construction and maintenance warning.
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column6: Do not pass
column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 12. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: look for a human flagger.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 13. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: guide drivers.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: A 3-way intersection is ahead
column8: You must bear either right or left

column2: 16. This sign indicates:
column4: a church zone ahead.
column6: a side road.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Do not pass on the left.
column6: No U-turn

column2: 18. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column6: The road ends ahead

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: Do not enter

column2: 21. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: try your emergency lights.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 22. If you are involved in an accident, you are required to immediately:
column4: notify your family.
column6: drive to the closest police station to report the accident.

column2: 23. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 24. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 25. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: rideplaning.
column6: hydroplaning.

column2: 26. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 27. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 28. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 29. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column6: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column8: slow down and pass the bus with caution.

column2: 30. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: yellow warning lights.
column6: red lights.

column2: 31. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 32. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column6: in a tunnel.

column2: 33. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: look and listen for trains.
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 34. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: fresh air.
column6: drinking coffee.
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 35. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 36. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 37. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Turn on your cruise control.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 38. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 39. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: parking lights.
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 40. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: The other driver.
column6: You.
